info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 2:37PM CDT until July 12 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Tom Green.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms may produce up to 2 inches of rainfall. Minor flooding is expected to result from this rain in the advisory area, which includes San Angelo. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Christoval, Wall, Lake Nasworthy, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Twin Buttes Reservoir, O.c. Fisher Reservoir, Veribest, Vancourt, Knickerbocker, San Angelo State Park, Tankersley, Mereta and Us-67 Near The Irion-Tom Green County Line. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
